display.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
display.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: a dazzling display (=very good display) of flowers
The window display caught her eye.
a superb display of African masks
display.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a public performance of something that is intended to entertain people
display.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a part of a piece of equipment that shows information, for example a computer screen
display.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: This time the display flashed a red warning signal.
display.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The museum has a magnificent display of silver.

display.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily
display.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
All the exam results will be displayed on the noticeboard.
display.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to clearly show a feeling, attitude, or quality by what you do or say
display.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: She displayed no emotion on the witness stand.
ten piano pieces, each written to display the talents of individual players
display.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if a computer or something similar displays information, it shows it on its screen

display.translation[1].definitions[3].de: if a male bird or animal displays, it behaves in a particular way as a signal to other birds or animals, especially to attract a female
